description: FIL Lagos is the inaugural city-specific event for Filecoin in Lagos, marking it as the first of its kind in Nigeria. Launched as part of the Filecoin Orbit Community Program, it aims to foster a local hub for developers, entrepreneurs, and enthusiasts to explore Filecoin’s decentralized storage solutions, including the Filecoin Virtual Machine (FVM) and InterPlanetary File System (IPFS). The event aligns with Filecoin’s mission to create an open data economy by empowering African innovators to solve regional challenges like data sovereignty, affordable storage, and scalable Web3 infrastructure.
end_user:
It targets the following end users:
Developers and Innovators: Local tech enthusiasts and ETHNigeria alumni (e.g., DataVault NG and EcoTrack teams) who build and refine Filecoin-based solutions. They benefit from workshops, hackathons, and mentorship to scale projects.
Small Businesses and Startups: Entrepreneurs in Lagos’s $100B+ agri-sector or healthcare space who adopt EcoTrack or HealthLink Wallet to streamline operations and attract customers with transparent data.
General Public: Lagos residents, including unbanked individuals, who use DataVault NG for personal data security or RemitChain for remittances, empowered by community education on Filecoin’s benefits.
Educational Institutions: Students and educators in Lagos who leverage Block:edLearning (2nd Place Filecoin project) for censorship-resistant, globally accessible educational content.
